summary: The Capping Prescription Costs Act of 2025 aims to limit cost-sharing for prescription drugs. It amends existing healthcare laws to cap annual out-of-pocket prescription drug costs at $2,000 for individuals and $4,000 for families starting in 2026. This cap will be adjusted annually based on the Consumer Price Index. The bill applies to qualified health plans, group health plans, and is integrated into the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
